taxonomicnotes: The name H. nemurus has been used for fishes throughout Southeast Asia. It is now restricted to a species distributed only in Java, with populations in other parts of the Sundaic region (Malay Peninsula, Sumatra and Borneo) referring to a different species (H.H. Ng pers. comm. 2011), while the populations from the Mekong, Chao Phraya and Mae Khlong drainages are most likely H. spilopterus (Ng and Rainboth 1999; H.H. Ng pers. comm. 2011).
rationale: The species appears to be still common in Java. It is found in rivers (polluted as some of them may be), and also known from impoundments. It is considered Least Concern at present, however there is a need for comprehensive surveys of Java's freshwater systems to ascertain the true status of its biodiversity.
